channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Facebook launches Messenger Kids in Philippines
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Social media company Facebook has rolled out Messenger Kids in the Philippines, a mobile application that allows children below 12 years old to use video chat and messaging features in a parent-controlled environment.

item.title: Gierran likely to stop PhilHealth’s IRM
item.author: Emmanuel Tupas
item.description: Newly appointed Philippine Health Insurance Corp. president and chief executive officer Dante Gierran is not keen on continuing PhilHealth’s controversial interim reimbursement mechanism.

item.title: Duterte trusts Duque, waits for task force report
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Malacañang respects the recommendation of the Senate to indict Health Secretary Francisco Duque III, former Philippine Health Insurance Corp. president and chief executive officer Ricardo Morales and other PhilHealth officials, but it is not enough for President Duterte to let go of the embattled health chief.

item.title: Duterte to Cascolan: Rid PNP of corruption
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte has given his marching orders to new Philippine National Police chief Camilo Cascolan: cleanse the PNP ranks of scalawags as part of efforts to maintain the integrity of the police force.

item.title: AFP chief, 29 other military officers breeze through CA
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: The Commission on Appointments has approved the nomination of Gen. Gilbert Gapay as Armed Forces chief and the promotion of 29 other senior military officers.

item.title: Go Negosyo leads pooled swab testing in Makati
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: Six thousand people are set to be tested for coronavirus disease 2019 under the private sector’s pilot implementation of the pooled polymerase chain reaction test in Makati City.

item.title: Palace: Philippines can set aside unresolved South China Sea issues
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The Philippines can “set aside” unresolved issues in the South China Sea and pursue investment projects with Chinese firms since the arbitral ruling has upheld Manila’s sovereign rights over its exclusive economic zone, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: Lorenzana sees flattening of curve this month
item.author: Michael Punongbayan
item.description: Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana, chair of the National Task Force Against COVID-19, is confident that the flattening of the curve will finally be achieved within the month.

item.title: House to allow social media in budget talks
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Netizens can now join deliberations on the P4.5-trillion national budget for 2021 when the House of Representatives starts its hearings tomorrow, in the spirit of transparency, Speaker Alan Peter Cayetano said.

item.title: Olongapo RTC orders Pemberton’s release
item.author: Bebot Sison Jr.
item.description: The Regional Trial Court Branch 74 here yesterday granted the motion of US Marine Lance Corporal Joseph Scott Pemberton, who was convicted of killing transgender Jeffrey ”Jennifer” Laude in 2014, for an early release through the Good Conduct Time Allowance.
